*div1 type="summary"* *p*James F. Perry to Austin, October 26, 1833. Conditions in Texas during Austin's absence—flood, cholera, malaria.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Peach Point*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="10-26-1833">26th Oct. 1833*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Your letters of the *date_mentioned n="07-30-1833">30th of July*/date_mentioned*—the *date_mentioned n="09-05-1833">5th */date_mentioned*and *date_mentioned n="09-11-1833">11th of Sept*/date_mentioned*. dated at *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*came to hand two days ago it gave us verry great pleasure to receive them and to hear of your good state of health, as we had heard through *person_mentioned*Williams */person_mentioned*that you had wrote him you had at the time you wrote all the premonetary simptims of the Cholera and as it had been very fatle here scarsely any who was attaced with it that recovered. We was very much alarmed for your safety but kind providence has preserved you to us and to the *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*—Which still needs your Guardien hand to guid them through.*/p*
*p*To give you an account of the over flow Cholara, Fevers and deaths in the *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*I presume would be unnessary as I expect *person_mentioned*Mr Williams*/person_mentioned* has given you full acts. We would have wrote you long since but did not think our Leatters would reach you as When you left *location_mentioned*Matamoras */location_mentioned*you expected your stay in *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*would be very short we will now give you a short act. of the sickness and deaths in our emediate *location_mentioned*neighbourhood */location_mentioned*on your return you will find a great vacuam in *location_mentioned*this part of the country*/location_mentioned*, but before we say anything of the *location_mentioned*neighborhood */location_mentioned*we will give you some account of our own *location_mentioned*famales*/location_mentioned* sickness. Our famely has not been entirely clear of sickness since *date_mentioned n="06-xx-1833">June */date_mentioned*and part of the time scarsely enough well of either *person_mentioned*servants */person_mentioned*or *person_mentioned*whites */person_mentioned*to wait on the sick and at the worst of our sickness there was not a *person_mentioned*Physician */person_mentioned*could be had or a *person_mentioned*neighbour */person_mentioned*to call to see us *person_mentioned*Emily*/person_mentioned* was verry low indeed I scarsely thought she could recover. But it was the will of providence to save her to her *person_mentioned*famaly */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*but our dear little *person_mentioned*Mary*/person_mentioned* it was her lot to be taken from us. She was sick only five days. With the fever and was called of very sudenly and verry unexpectedly. She died on the *date_mentioned n="08-04-1833">4th august*/date_mentioned*. We feel and regret her loss much— the balance of the *person_mentioned*famaly */person_mentioned*are now generally in tolarable health. Some of them have still slight chills and fevers but we hope they will soon ware off as the weather is getting quit[e] cool on the *date_mentioned n="10-21-1833">21st */date_mentioned*we had a heavy white frost which is considered very early here.*/p*
*p*With regard to our crops and improvements we have done verry little since the *date_mentioned n="06-15-1833">middle of June */date_mentioned*as the *person_mentioned*Blacks */person_mentioned*were all sick as well as ourselves we made a good crop of corn and pumpkins about 8 or 900 bushels of corn and plenty of pumpkins. We planted 13 acres of cotton the *date_mentioned n="06-24-1833">last week in June*/date_mentioned* which bid fair to do pretty well but the early frost has injured it much as it had not commenced opening we do not expect much of a crop cotten is now a fine price in *location_mentioned*N. O.*/location_mentioned* from 16 to 18 cts. There is fine cropes in this *location_mentioned*neighbourhood */location_mentioned*and I am told all over the *location_mentioned*coloney */location_mentioned*where the overflow did not injure it the season has been very wet at least untile about the *date_mentioned n="09-15-1833">middle of September */date_mentioned*(since prety dry) together with the over flow is the reason, assigned for sickly season, this *location_mentioned*low country*/location_mentioned* has been visited more severely with sickness and deaths than the *location_mentioned*upper*/location_mentioned* but that has not bean entirely clear, there has been recently a good deal of sickness at *location_mentioned*San felepe*/location_mentioned* and above and a good many deaths in our *location_mentioned*neighbourhood */location_mentioned*we have lost old*person_mentioned* Mr McNeel*/person_mentioned* (fever) *person_mentioned*Mr. Westall*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*James */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Emeline*/person_mentioned* (cholera) and *person_mentioned*Mr Munson*/person_mentioned* (fever) which leves a very considerable vackancey here in *location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned*our friend *person_mentioned*John austin*/person_mentioned* both his *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Mrs Wm austin*/person_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*Anthony the printer*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Bradly */person_mentioned*and a number of *person_mentioned*negroes */person_mentioned*all died at *location_mentioned*Westall */location_mentioned*with the cholara. there was six or seven corps there at one time before they could be buried as the *person_mentioned*neighbours*/person_mentioned* were afraid to approach them a great many more of your *person_mentioned*acquantances */person_mentioned*you will find gon among them are *person_mentioned*Doctr Cox*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*counsel*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*counsels wife*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*child*/person_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Jno Cox*/person_mentioned* on the *location_mentioned*Bernard */location_mentioned*and a number of others not recolected it is said there was 80 *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*died at *location_mentioned*Brazoria*/location_mentioned* in the course of the *date_mentioned n="Summer-1833">summer */date_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Velasco */location_mentioned*was nearly depopulated by the cholera.*/p*
*p*Since you left I wrote to *location_mentioned*Missouri */location_mentioned*for a *person_mentioned*Mr Alex Somervill*/person_mentioned* a man I have been acquainted with for many years and in whom I have full confidence he come in may and *person_mentioned*Austin */person_mentioned*and him have been in charge of the *location_mentioned*store */location_mentioned*since I gave him an interest as I thought it best. *person_mentioned*Austin */person_mentioned*was at *location_mentioned*school */location_mentioned*most of the *date_mentioned n="SUmmer-1833">summer */date_mentioned*learning Spanish and says he has improved a great deal, they have sold a good many goods as they had the best assortment in *location_mentioned*San Felepe*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Mr S.*/person_mentioned* is going in a few days to *location_mentioned*N O */location_mentioned*to get a few goods to replenish *person_mentioned*Joel */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Beared */person_mentioned*are now gone to collect your cattle as it is the first oppertunity we have had all *date_mentioned n="Summer-1833">sumer */date_mentioned*in concequence of the wet season the heat and the flies, *person_mentioned*Col Philips*/person_mentioned* has been laid up all *date_mentioned n="Summer-1833">summer */date_mentioned*with his sore leg. fever etc *person_mentioned*Mrs. P.*/person_mentioned* is well the last acts. "We have *person_mentioned*Mr Pilgrim*/person_mentioned* Teaching here *person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* is going to school from his *person_mentioned*grand mothers*/person_mentioned* he is a smart boy and *person_mentioned*Mr. Pilgram*/person_mentioned* says he will learn well *person_mentioned*Guy */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*Steph */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Eliza */person_mentioned*are going and as soon as *person_mentioned*Joel */person_mentioned*gets done writing some accounts I have him to do, I will send him. *person_mentioned*Lavinia */person_mentioned*wishes to be kindly rememberd to you she leves for the *location_mentioned*U. S.*/location_mentioned* in a few days, *person_mentioned*Simon */person_mentioned*is well and has been a good boy. */p*
*p*[J. F. Perry]*/p*
*/div1*
